Description: Wheelmade ceramic beaker in kaolinite clay. Vessel has slightly flaring walls and a rounded base, constructed of fine eggshell ware at only 2mm thick. Covered in a thick cream slip and painted with two black painted lines below rim and above base; between are four black painted elaborate ankhs with a cross-hatching fill. On the base is a black painted florette with four petals. Vessel is incompletely re-assembled from fragments.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 19) (Type A15)
